# Demo outline

Overall goal: Walk through all the lego pieces of Claude Code, show how they can be mix and matched, give resources of viewers to be able to build their own systems.

***WIP\!***

| Topic | Talking Points | Demo | Todo | Resources |
| :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- |
| Getting started with Claude Code | Installation and ‘claude’ in terminal to start Visualizing: Using in an IDE vs Obsidian Obsidian \- great for more text-based work Free. No need to pay since you can sync work with git. IDE \- use for coding challenges | Installation /claude in terminal |  | [Anthropic’s quick start guide](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/quickstart) |
| Basics | Can search, read, and write files Can search the web and do research Copy & paste images | Things you’ve seen an LLM do before **Search & read files** “Tell me how many user interviews we’ve done” “What were the action items from the last Dark Mode meeting?” **View images:** Get feedback on a Slide **Search the web:** “Search the web for best Claude Code practices for product managers” **Running code:** “Get transcript for youtube video” New things – agents \+ writing files Parallelize tasks with agents : “Individually research the latest specs for the flagship 2025 Apple, Google, and Samsung smartphones. Create individual markdown files for each in a new folder.” | Create user interview demo files Create Dark Mode meeting note files Prep mock slide image to show AI Prep example for parallelized task Import transcript from previous Product Growth podcast |  |
| Visualizing files | IDE vs Obsidian Obsidian – better for text-based work, markdown files IDE – used for coding	 | Show opening folder in Obsidian Show opening folder in Cursor Show the created files from above |  |  |
| Claude.md | [Claude.md](http://Claude.md) file is the god of the project\! [Claude.md](http://Claude.md) vs prompts CLAUDE.md instructions: Treated as immutable system rules that define operational boundaries User prompts: Interpreted as flexible requests that must work within those established rules | /init to make [Claude.md](http://Claude.md) file Detected conventions File structure documentation Dependency analysis Code patterns Add rules to [Claude.md](http://Claude.md) with \# \# "Always ask before deleting a file" | Show some examples of [claude.md](http://claude.md) files  |  |
| Usage of files | Now that we’re in the project, we can start to use all the information in here in interesting ways. Reference information Business information Writing styles Examples | PRD creation Show file with business information Show files with good PRDs “Please create a PRD for \[business\] using \[writing style\] and see \[folder\] for examples” Summarizing customer interviews “Please take all these raw transcripts and create a detailed executive summary in the same folder” Agent example Getting action items from meeting transcript “Please take all these raw transcripts and create a detailed executive summary in the same folder” | Create business info file Create example PRDs to reference for examples Create writing style examples Create customer interviews Create meeting transcripts |  |
| Slash commands | You can create reusable commands – think of them like stored prompts | Show how to make /commands Show meeting note command | Create PRD command Create internal release announcement command Examples |  |
| Planning mode | Now moving onto heavier use cases using different modes **Edit mode:** Asks permission before making changes (default) **Auto-accept mode:** Makes changes without asking (best for most work) **Plan mode:** Creates plans without writing code (perfect for thinking through problems) Killer feature is automatic to-do lists | Show planning mode for  Creating new persona prompts Running them against an example with different models Putting outputs into new files to review | Add API keys to .env Prep example |  |
| MCPs | Tools for Claude Code to use Can give these to dedicated agents Some examples  TaskMaster AI Playwright Reddit MCP Google Drive MCP Notion MCP | Show examples Perplexity \+ Reddit MCP |  | [https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers)  [https://github.com/punkpeye/awesome-mcp-servers](https://github.com/punkpeye/awesome-mcp-servers)  |
| Sub-agents | Completely new instances of Claude with their own prompts and tools You could run the Perplexity \+ Reddit MCP we saw earlier for many problems at once | Show PRD writing agent | Add PRD writing agent | [https://github.com/VoltAgent/awesome-claude-code-subagents](https://github.com/VoltAgent/awesome-claude-code-subagents)  [https://github.com/wshobson/agents](https://github.com/wshobson/agents)  [https://www.subagents.cc/](https://www.subagents.cc/)  |

1. demos, use CCPM to brainstorm PRD, flesh out requirements, and spin up agents for implementation

Resources:

* Review of how it all works, not a ton of specifics: [https://claudelog.com/](https://claudelog.com/)  
* MCPs:  
  * [https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers)  
  * [https://github.com/punkpeye/awesome-mcp-servers](https://github.com/punkpeye/awesome-mcp-servers)  
* Subagents  
  * [https://github.com/VoltAgent/awesome-claude-code-subagents](https://github.com/VoltAgent/awesome-claude-code-subagents)   
  * [https://github.com/wshobson/agents](https://github.com/wshobson/agents)   
  * [https://www.subagents.cc/](https://www.subagents.cc/) 

Appendix

* Opportunity cost for your time has never been higher. These things can ALWAYS be running.  
  [![][image1]](https://claudelog.com/mechanics/you-are-the-main-thread/)  
  * What asynchronous process could I have running in the background that could be delivering value?  
* Examples  
  * Super recruiter for sourcing and screening talent. We're specific about looking for people that have at least 2 promotions at 2 different companies. This will use scrape the web and return candidates to us which we can then message. MCPs: Browserbase, Apify  
  * Business intelligence report to give me actionable business insights and recommendations that I previously had to wait days or weeks for. Now, I can quickly see how we're trending on conversion rates, speed-to-lead, and pipeline health indicators. It produces a comprehensive 47-section report that includes data validation, metric calculations, trend identification, correlation analysis, and an executive summary. The report provides high, medium, and long-term strategic recommendations (e.g., expanding AI tool suites, launching paid search campaigns, optimizing high-converting channels like ChatGPT referrals, creating content for high-volume keywords). MCPs: Gong, HubSpot, GA4  
* [I Built 6 AI Employees in 10 Minutes (They Don't Sleep)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H_UqPaAJk5Q)  
* [https://www.subagents.cc/agents/planning-prd-agent](https://www.subagents.cc/agents/planning-prd-agent)  
* [https://www.subagents.cc/agents/mobile-ux-optimizer](https://www.subagents.cc/agents/mobile-ux-optimizer)   
* [https://www.subagents.cc/agents/ux-researcher](https://www.subagents.cc/agents/ux-researcher)   
* [https://www.subagents.cc/agents/project-shipper](https://www.subagents.cc/agents/project-shipper)
